BestSoFar.framework.core.helper

Class Mediator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • BestSoFar.framework.core.helper.Mediator<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MediatorImpl

    public abstract class Mediator<T>
extends Object
    Mediator objects contain data that was produced from a Processor object, and can be fed into another Processor object.

    Each Mediator has a link to the Mediator object which was fed into the Processor that created it (ie. the 'previous' Mediator). The first Mediator in this linked list is an 'empty' Mediator (created using Mediator.createEmpty()) where both the data contained in it and the previous Mediator are null, and the History is History.getEpoch().

    Each Mediator also has a History object which represents the list of Processor objects which created it. Two Mediator objects which were created by the exact same procession of Processor objects will share the same History object (ie. mediator1.getHistory() == mediator2.getHistory()) regardless of whether the Mediator objects' data are the same or not.

    • Method Detail

      • createEmpty

        public static Mediator<?> createEmpty()
        Creates an empty Mediator, which is used as the starting element from which future Mediator objects (which actually contain data) are created. Its 'data' and 'previous' variables are null, and its History object is set at the epoch (ie. History.getEpoch()).
        Returns:
        an empty Mediator, from which Mediator objects (which contain data) can be created.

      • createNext

        public abstract <U> Mediator<U> createNext(Processor<?,?> creator,
                         U data)
        Create the output Mediator from this input Mediator, given the newly-created 'data'.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the type of the supplied data.
        Parameters:
        creator - the Processor that used this input Mediator to produce the supplied data.
        data - the data the Processor created from this input Mediator.
        Returns:
        an output Mediator containing 'data' created by 'creator' using this Mediator as input.

      • isEmpty

        public abstract boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true iff this is an empty Mediator (ie. the first in a sequence of Mediator objects).
        Returns:
        true iff this is an empty Mediator (ie. the first in a sequence of Mediator objects).

      • getData

        public abstract T getData()
        Gets the data contained in this Mediator object.
        Returns:
        the data contained in this Mediator object.

      • getHistory

        public abstract History getHistory()
        Gets the History object (ie. the sequence of Processor which led to this Mediator object's creation).
        Returns:
        the History object for this Mediator.

      • getPrevious

        public abstract Mediator<?> getPrevious()
        Gets the Mediator object from which this one was created.
        Returns:
        the Mediator object from which this one was created.

      • rollbackMediators

        public static <I,O> Set<Mediator<I>> rollbackMediators(Set<Mediator<O>> mediators)
        For every Mediator m in mediators, this returns m.getPrevious() in a set.

        NB. Since duplicates are not allowed in a set, if any Mediator objects in mediators share the same previous Mediator, it will appear only once in the returned set.

        Type Parameters:
        I - the parameterised type of the previous Mediator objects.
        O - the parameterised type of the supplied Mediator objects.
        Parameters:
        mediators - the Mediator objects to roll back to their previous Mediator objects.
        Returns:
        the Mediator objects that preceded the supplied mediators set.
